value.title: Dynamic Filtering with Power BI and Analysis Services
value.excerpt: In this video, Patrick answers your question about how to do this in Analysis Services Tabular and Multidimensional. Also, he adds a little bit of SQL to the mix.  Make sure to watch the previous dynamic filtering videos to understand the basics of how to do this.  https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=EXObcA9G9Vw

value.title: Fuzzy match / merging in Power BI Desktop (October 2018)
value.excerpt: In this video, we look at the new fuzzy match / merging option within the October 2018 version of Power BI Desktop. This feature is incredibly powerful when it comes to data matching and can be adjusted to meet your needs.  LET'S CONNECT!  Guy in a Cube -- https://guyinacube.com -- http://twitter.com/guyinacube

value.title: Get more info with Power Query tracing in Power BI Desktop

value.title: Get your Power BI Report Server Product Key (Minute Monday)

value.title: Microsoft R, Data Science and Power BI
value.excerpt: In this video, we are joined by Buck Woody. Buck is a data scientist at Microsoft. We work together to show how you can easily visualize Microsoft R in Power BI. We use Microsoft R Open and then move onto Power BI Desktop.  The example used in Microsoft R Open is the Anscombe's quartet.   Download sample

value.title: Modify the Power BI Concatenated list of values quick measure
value.excerpt: Patrick walks you through how to use a Power BI quick measure and then easily modify it. value.title: 'OraOLEDB.Oracle' provider is not registered

value.title: Power BI Auditing
value.excerpt: In this video, I look at the Power BI Auditing feature that was made available a few weeks ago. I show how to turn it on and how to search. This can be helpful with understanding who is doing what within your organization.  Offical Docs: https://powerbi.microsoft.com/en-us/documentation/powerbi-admin-auditing/

value.title: Power BI Desktop And Role-Playing Dimensions: Can you do it?
value.excerpt: In this video, Patrick talks about Power BI Desktop and role-playing dimensions. Can you even do this in Power BI Desktop? Patrick shows you why one particular way is not recommended as it will cause trouble. And then show you how you can use DAX within Power BI Desktop to take this to the next level.

value.title: REPLAY Special end of year stream w/ Will Thompson (Dec 12, 2020) *Charity Stream*
value.excerpt: Join us live as we answer your questions about Power BI!   Every time the answer is "It depends", Will will donate $25 to charity! value.title: Report level measures with Power BI live connections
value.excerpt: In this video, Patrick looks at how you can create report level measures, within Power BI Desktop, against SQL Server Analysis Services Tabular live connections, or against a Power BI service dataset live connection. value.title: Row-Level Security in Power BI - Revisited
value.excerpt: We had some recent changes to Row-level security in Power BI. Row-level security (RLS) was moved to be configured in Power BI Desktop with the June 2016 release.  I walk through how you could can configure this now in Power BI Desktop. I also talk about some of the limitations.  LET'S CONNECT!  Guy in

value.title: Tooltips, tooltips, tooltips in Power BI
value.excerpt: In this video, Patrick shows how you can display multiple values within a tooltip for a visual. He walks through the DAX measure and also shows some pitfalls to look out for when it comes to filter context.  Go here for the sample DAX statement: https://guyinacube.com/2017/06/tooltips-tooltips-tooltips-power-bi/

value.title: Use a KPI in a table within Power BI

value.title: Using DAX to format a list of values in Power BI Desktop
value.excerpt: Alberto Ferrari joins Patrick to walk through how you can use DAX to format a list of values within Power BI Desktop. This takes the concatenate values quick measure to the next level.  Original Quick Measure video - https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=SjSKCZtiNlI  Alberto's article - https://www.sqlbi.com/blog/alberto/2018/12/20/displaying-a-list-of-selected-months/

value.title: Using different languages with the Power BI site
value.excerpt: I look at how your browser languages affect what is displayed. This all comes down to your browsers and the language settings within. Different browsers are configured differently. Fiddler can show you what your language order is.  SUBSCRIBE! https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCFp1vaKzpfvoGai0vE5VJ0w?sub_confirmation=1
